Summary
I am a Master Mariner with Principal Warfare, Specialist Navigation
and Command experience at Sea over a 16-year span. Since
coming ashore, I have further developed my expertise in a variety
of senior roles encompassing, change, culture, human factors,
organisational and learning & development. 
My technical and business acumen continue to grow within all
fields of engineering, science, safety, environment, leadership
development and industry innovation. I have become a key point of
contact to the organisations and board members I consult for

Summary
I am a Master Mariner with Principal Warfare, Specialist Navigation
and Command experience at Sea over a 16-year span. Since
coming ashore, I have further developed my expertise in a variety
of senior roles encompassing, change, culture, human factors,
organisational and learning & development. 
My technical and business acumen continue to grow within all
fields of engineering, science, safety, environment, leadership
development and industry innovation. I have become a key point of
contact to the organisations and board members I consult for and I
have gained their respect to deliver strategies to further develop and
future proof their business.
Experience
MZ Skin by Dr. Maryam Zamani
Operations and People Director
April 2021 - Present  (1 month)
London, England, United Kingdom
Leading Lights Consultancy
Director at Leading Lights Consultancy 
November 2020 - Present  (6 months)
London, England, United Kingdom
Having spent 13 years at sea in the Navy, followed by a corporate career
in various senior leadership positions centred around people and progress,
this has ensured that developing organisations and teams is in my DNA.
My experience encompasses change management, organisational culture,
building strategies and ensuring sustainable growth across all aspects of
business. 
www.leadinglightsconsultancy.co.uk
  Page 1 of 4
   
Lloyd's Register
13 years 9 months
Senior Principal Organisational & Learning Development and Head of
Graduate Program
December 2010 - November 2020  (10 years)
London, England Metropolitan Area
Organisation and Learning & Development
Reporting directly to the Global Human Resources Director and being a key
member of the Leadership Team, I was responsible for medium to long term
people & organisational development strategy and responsible for sustaining,
updating, developing and delivering globally best in class learning solutions
for our technical community of surveyors, naval architects and engineers.
I lead and develop learning strategy to ensure technical governance and
accreditation are maintained for the business, including budget and resources,
ownership of the learning & development function within Marine & Offshore
and leading the Global team to support our community and deliver training
both in classroom, blended and virtually.
Graduate Scheme Management
I believe in growing and nurturing talent from within. I play a pivotal role in
leading short- and long-term strategy of the Marine & Offshore Graduate
program. I have full ownership of managing the graduate scheme – from global
recruitment and selection, continued mentoring, technical projects and ongoing
learning development, understanding individual core strengths to placing
them in world-wide locations best suited to both business and individual
development needs with the end goal to ensure that throughout the 4 year
robust program they successfully gain chartership in their relevant fields of
expertise.
New Business Integration Manager and Human Factors Consultancy
Lead
August 2008 - December 2010  (2 years 5 months)
Reporting to the Managing Director of Human Engineering (acquired by Lloyds
Register in 2008), I was responsible for the integration of Human Factors (the
consultancy side of the Human Engineering) into the Marine business and
the leadership of the 3-year strategy plan, new business development and
key commercial growth. With a primary focus on building the human factors
consultancy capability, I lead multiple projects with external clients on key
human reliability and safety performance issues in the marine business – with
the highlight being a global project with one of our top 5 clients across all their
  Page 2 of 4
   
global offices and all fleet sectors (Cruise, Bulk, Container and Gas ships),
which resulted in me assessing and improving their safety and culture and
taking them from a low level engagement and poor safety culture to one of the
leading organisations w

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
